تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن


Dear Ingie,

Dear Patrick,

Please find attached photos of the installed Baccarat Arik Levy Tuile de Cristal chandelier. The piece is now fully in place and the lighting has been successfully tested.

In the coming days, the ceiling will be closed and completed by Finasi. As this work progresses, we will provide a thin protective plastic covering over the chandelier to shield it from dust.

Please find attached photos of the installed Baccarat Arik Levy Tuile de Cristal chandelier. The piece is now fully in place and the lighting has been successfully tested.

In the coming days, the ceiling will be closed and completed by Finasi. As this work progresses, we will provide a thin protective plastic covering over the chandelier to shield it from dust.

Given that each crystal panel is individually suspended, special care will be required from the Finasi team to ensure none are dislodged—especially when the dust cover is removed. I would recommend that Ram oversee this phase closely to ensure the chandelier is carefully protected throughout the ceiling works.

At the top of the chandelier, on the mirrored section, a protective film remains in place. We suggest removing this during the final styling of the dining room, once all dust-generating activities are complete.

The chandelier comes with eight spare crystal panels, which will be stored securely in its designated box. We will also propose a temporary storage solution for the Baccarat wooden crates in the basement, and await your direction on a preferred long-term storage location.

As always, we remain at your disposal.

Warm regards,
Linton

Dear Ingie,

Dear Patrick,

Please find attached photos of the installed Baccarat Arik Levy Tuile de Cristal chandelier. The piece is now fully in place and the lighting has been successfully tested.

In the coming days, the ceiling will be closed and completed by Finasi. As this work progresses, we will provide a thin protective plastic covering over the chandelier to shield it from dust.

Please find attached photos of the installed Baccarat Arik Levy Tuile de Cristal chandelier. The piece is now fully in place and the lighting has been successfully tested.

In the coming days, the ceiling will be closed and completed by Finasi. As this work progresses, we will provide a thin protective plastic covering over the chandelier to shield it from dust.

Given that each crystal panel is individually suspended, special care will be required from the Finasi team to ensure none are dislodged—especially when the dust cover is removed. I would recommend that Ram oversee this phase closely to ensure the chandelier is carefully protected throughout the ceiling works.

At the top of the chandelier, on the mirrored section, a protective film remains in place. We suggest removing this during the final styling of the dining room, once all dust-generating activities are complete.

The chandelier comes with eight spare crystal panels, which will be stored securely in its designated box. We will also propose a temporary storage solution for the Baccarat wooden crates in the basement, and await your direction on a preferred long-term storage location.

As always, we remain at your disposal.

Warm regards,
Linton
